ch.cmbntr.eventbus

Class EventBus

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.cmbntr.eventbus.EventBus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class EventBus
extends Object
implements Runnable
    Asynchronous event bus, which is compatible with the Guava EventBus (i.e. it uses Subscribe, AllowConcurrentEvents and DeadEvent).
    Author:
    Michael Locher

      Dispatches an event.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventBus

        public EventBus()
        Creates this, with a "default" identifier.

      • EventBus

        public EventBus(String identifier)
        Creates this. Will use a custom single thread for batched event dispatching and handling.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the bus identifier

      • EventBus

        public EventBus(String identifier,
        boolean batchDispatching,
        Executor handlerExecutor,
        Executor dispatcher)
        Creates this.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the bus identifier
        batchDispatching - if true, event processing is batched (same thread per handler/event)
        handlerExecutor - the executor which will performs the handler callbacks
        dispatcher - the executor which will perform the dispatching

      • EventBus

        public EventBus(com.google.common.base.Function<? super Method,Handler> handlerBuilder,
        Executor dispatcher)
        Creates this.
        Parameters:
        handlerBuilder - the factory for handlers
        dispatcher - the executor which will perform the dispatching

      • EventBus

        protected EventBus(com.google.common.base.Predicate<? super Method> isHandler,
        com.google.common.base.Function<? super Method,Handler> handlerBuilder,
        Executor dispatcher)
        Creates this.
        Parameters:
        isHandler - determines if a method is a handler
        handlerBuilder - the factory for handlers
        dispatcher - the executor which will perform the dispatching

    • Method Detail

      • newHandlerSet

        protected Set<Handler> newHandlerSet()
        Provides a new empty set for handlers. Note: the set must be thread-safe.
        Returns:
        a new set

      • dispatch

        protected void dispatch(Object event)
        Dispatches an event. Will be called from the dispatcher executor.
        Parameters:
        event - the event

      • post

        public void post(Object event)
        Posts an event to all registered handlers.
        Parameters:
        event - event to post.

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • register

        public void register(Object target)
        Registers all handler methods on object to receive events.
        Parameters:
        object - object whose handler methods should be registered.

      • registerWeak

        public void registerWeak(Object target)
        Registers all handler methods on object to receive events, but only keeps a weak reference to the object.
        Parameters:
        object - object whose handler methods should be registered.

      • unregister

        public void unregister(Object target)
        Unregisters all handler methods on a registered object.
        Parameters:
        object - object whose handler methods should be unregistered.
